HDG.QB.content: Dasein “held into (hineingehalten)” “this” nothing: humans hold free the site (Ort) for the totally other (ganz Anderen) than beings, so that w/in this openness something like coming to presence (An-Wesen) (Being) can be given > Der Mensch ist der Platzhalter des Nichts
HDG.QB.linkedContent: Dasein “held into (hineingehalten)” “this” nothing: humans hold free the site (Ort) for the totally other (ganz Anderen) than beings, so that w/in this openness something like coming to presence (An-Wesen) (Being) can be given > Der Mensch ist der Platzhalter des Nichts

HDG.FS.content: destiny of being (Geschick des Seins), will we be able to think it on its own terms [arrival]?: the task of thinking (Aufgabe des Denkens), which poetry is “heilsame Gefahr (wholesome danger)”: poetry has been faithful to site (Stätte) of inceptual upsurge (ursprünglichen Auf-gehens) [philosophy less faithful?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: destiny of being (Geschick des Seins), will we be able to think it on its own terms [arrival]?: the task of thinking (Aufgabe des Denkens), which poetry is “heilsame Gefahr (wholesome danger)”: poetry has been faithful to site (Stätte) of inceptual upsurge (ursprünglichen Auf-gehens) [philosophy less faithful?]

HDG.FS.content: logos as gathering, “projects itself toward things that appear in their gathering” > for Greek thought, presencing of human is opening inception for oppositional presencing of World > alētheia: encounter (Begegnung) btwn that which presences and being is a self-opening, welcomes (Empfang) presence [a site, Ort?] > alētheia can’t be translated as truth
HDG.FS.linkedContent: logos as gathering, “projects itself toward things that appear in their gathering” > for Greek thought, presencing of human is opening inception for oppositional presencing of World > alētheia: encounter (Begegnung) btwn that which presences and being is a self-opening, welcomes (Empfang) presence [a site, Ort?] > alētheia can’t be translated as truth

HDG.DL.content: transformation (Verwandlung) of thinking occurs as a passage (Wanderung), one site left for another, sites placed in discussion (Erörterung), one site (Ort) is metaphysics, the other we leave w/out a name [overcoming metaphysics] > in leaving behind metaphysics, Heidegger leaves behind aesthetics grounded in metaphysics: in such a way that we can give thought to nature of aesthetics, direct it back (verweisen) w/in its boundaries
HDG.DL.linkedContent: transformation (Verwandlung) of thinking occurs as a passage (Wanderung), one site left for another, sites placed in discussion (Erörterung), one site (Ort) is metaphysics, the other we leave w/out a name [overcoming metaphysics] > in leaving behind metaphysics, Heidegger leaves behind aesthetics grounded in metaphysics: in such a way that we can give thought to nature of aesthetics, direct it back (verweisen) w/in its boundaries

HDG.DL.content: Heidegger remains sparing in words that would lead to a discussion (erörtern) of Sage, would call for a journey (Wanderung) into the Ortschaft of the essence of Sage > what prompts his reserve (Züruckhaltung), insight into the untouchable (Unantastbare), veiled from us by the Geheimnis of Sage [arrive at site of Sage or never arrive?]
HDG.DL.linkedContent: Heidegger remains sparing in words that would lead to a discussion (erörtern) of Sage, would call for a journey (Wanderung) into the Ortschaft of the essence of Sage > what prompts his reserve (Züruckhaltung), insight into the untouchable (Unantastbare), veiled from us by the Geheimnis of Sage [arrive at site of Sage or never arrive?]

HDG.LP.content: to discuss (erörten): placing/situating the site & heeding it (das Weisen in den Ort und das Beachten des Ortes) > take all our daring to take no more than these preliminary steps (vorbereitenden Schritte)
HDG.LP.linkedContent: to discuss (erörten): placing/situating the site & heeding it (das Weisen in den Ort und das Beachten des Ortes) > take all our daring to take no more than these preliminary steps (vorbereitenden Schritte)

HDG.LP.content: site (Ort), [originally means] die Spitze des Speers (point of the spear) [Derrida repeatedly refers to this statement], gathers into itself, to the highest and most extreme (Äusserste), a gathering that penetrates (durchdringt)/pervades (durchwest) everything > a site gathers & preserves (verwahrt) what it gathers, not like an encapsulated shell (Kapsel), but by shining through, lighting up, and thus releasing (entlässt) what it gathers to its own nature
HDG.LP.linkedContent: site (Ort), [originally means] die Spitze des Speers (point of the spear) [Derrida repeatedly refers to this statement], gathers into itself, to the highest and most extreme (Äusserste), a gathering that penetrates (durchdringt)/pervades (durchwest) everything > a site gathers & preserves (verwahrt) what it gathers, not like an encapsulated shell (Kapsel), but by shining through, lighting up, and thus releasing (entlässt) what it gathers to its own nature

HDG.LP.content: poet’s statement remains unspoken, from its site rise waves, moving the Saying, each wave causes movement of Saying to flow back into ever more hidden source (verhüllteren Ursprung) > from metaphysical-aesthetic point of view: the site/source of wave holds (birgt) w/in hidden nature of what first appears as rhythm
HDG.LP.linkedContent: poet’s statement remains unspoken, from its site rise waves, moving the Saying, each wave causes movement of Saying to flow back into ever more hidden source (verhüllteren Ursprung) > from metaphysical-aesthetic point of view: the site/source of wave holds (birgt) w/in hidden nature of what first appears as rhythm

HDG.LP.content: strange “fremd”: Old High German fram, “forward to somewhere else (anderswohin vorwärts), underway toward (unterwegs nach),” dem Voraufbehaltenen entgegen > strange searches for site where can remain in its wandering: barely exposed to itself, still follows the call of the way to its own
HDG.LP.linkedContent: strange “fremd”: Old High German fram, “forward to somewhere else (anderswohin vorwärts), underway toward (unterwegs nach),” dem Voraufbehaltenen entgegen > strange searches for site where can remain in its wandering: barely exposed to itself, still follows the call of the way to its own

HDG.LP.content: night makes the thinker speak other words, can transmute because it too changes > Day’s decline not an end, but makes ready the beginning of Stranger’s wandering > the site of Trakl’s poems: die Abgeschiedenheit (apartness)
HDG.LP.linkedContent: night makes the thinker speak other words, can transmute because it too changes > Day’s decline not an end, but makes ready the beginning of Stranger’s wandering > the site of Trakl’s poems: die Abgeschiedenheit (apartness)

HDG.LP.content: as gathering, apartness has the nature of a site
HDG.LP.linkedContent: as gathering, apartness has the nature of a site

HDG.LP.content: Das Wesen der singenden Seele ist dann nur noch ein einziges Vorausschauen in die Bläue der Nacht, die jene stillere Frühe birgt [moral image of thought] [Gegenblick?] > nature of apartness is perfected (vollendet) [MOP? pure bastard?] > perfect site of poetic work: gathers those who died early, followed the stranger (gathers both stiller childhood & stranger’s grave)
HDG.LP.linkedContent: Das Wesen der singenden Seele ist dann nur noch ein einziges Vorausschauen in die Bläue der Nacht, die jene stillere Frühe birgt [moral image of thought] [Gegenblick?] > nature of apartness is perfected (vollendet) [MOP? pure bastard?] > perfect site of poetic work: gathers those who died early, followed the stranger (gathers both stiller childhood & stranger’s grave)

HDG.LP.content: grisly laughter of gold, poetry’s innermost site [?], a gathering, a unison (Einklang), meant for itself alone > Trakl’s ambiguity not imprecision but peerless rigor (Strenge) of him who entered “gerechten Anschauens (righteous vision)” and fittingly submits (fügt) to it: infinitely superior to all technical precision merely scientifically univocal [a higher univocality]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: grisly laughter of gold, poetry’s innermost site [?], a gathering, a unison (Einklang), meant for itself alone > Trakl’s ambiguity not imprecision but peerless rigor (Strenge) of him who entered “gerechten Anschauens (righteous vision)” and fittingly submits (fügt) to it: infinitely superior to all technical precision merely scientifically univocal [a higher univocality]
